intro: Anguina himalensis, commonly known as the Himalayan anguinid, is a species of flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas, where it thrives in cold and moist environments. The plant is characterized by its slender stems and small, clustered flowers that typically bloom in spring. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often covered with a fine layer of hairs, which helps in reducing water loss. Anguina himalensis is often found in rocky or alpine habitats, contributing to the biodiversity of its mountainous ecosystem.
